thread.title: Arsenal ace Hector Bellerin could face Hull City on Saturday after being given the all-clear following MRI scan
thread.title_full: Arsenal ace Hector Bellerin could face Hull City on Saturday after being given the all-clear following MRI scan

author: jorr
title: Arsenal ace Hector Bellerin could face Hull City on Saturday after being given the all-clear following MRI scan
text:
EFL Hec, he's ready to rumble Arsenal ace Hector Bellerin could face Hull City on Saturday after being given the all-clear following MRI scan 
The Spaniard suffered concussion after being elbowed by Marcos Alonso during last week's 3-1 defeat by Chelsea By CHARLIE WYETT Comments HECTOR BELLERIN could face Hull on Saturday. 
Arsenal’s right-back, knocked out at Chelsea, has been given the all-clear after an MRI scan. Getty Images Hector Bellerin suffered a concussion after clashing with Chelsea’s Marcos Alonso Getty Images Hector Bellerin was taken off after the incident Marcos Alonso scores for Chelsea against Arsenal but does he foul Bellerin at the same time? 
Bellerin, 21, suffered concussion after being elbowed by Marcos Alonso and Arsenal were unsure how long he would be out. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But the defender will now join in with training tomorrow. FA guidelines suggest concussed players should not play for 14 days but club doctors have the final say. Related stories TV TIMES Arsenal vs Hull: What TV channel is it on, what time is the match and what is SunSport's score prediction? Team News Arsenal vs Hull: Hector Bellerin a doubt with concussion but Elneny should return after AFCON heartbreak come and get me Arsenal and West Ham on alert as Alexandre Lacazette reveals he was to leave Lyon this summer Hang on, Hec Hector Bellerin to wait until Friday to return to full training after horror head injury against Chelsea Horror knock Unseen angle shows the terrifying moment Hector Bellerin's eyes roll back into his head after Marcos Alonso's collision in Chelsea defeat 'I'm recovering well at home' Hector Bellerin posts re-assuring update after being knocked-out during Chelsea defeat Meanwhile, Thierry Henry claims Arsenal have “a mental problem” and is not sure boss Arsene Wenger has the solution.
The Gunners’ record goalscorer has written off his former team’s title challenge after Saturday’s 3-1 defeat at Chelsea. 
Henry said: “What I saw against Chelsea is a mental problem and it’s not easy to manage. It’s 12 years since Arsenal won the title, something is missing.” Arsenal star Hector Bellerin shows up Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain at Basketball
